ranked_diseases.explanation: Strong match with multiple cardinal features including short neck, low posterior hairline, growth delay, cardiomyopathy, ptosis, hypertelorism, downslanted palpebral fissures, broad forehead, low-set ears, and feeding difficulties. PTPN11 mutation-associated.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Noonan Syndrome with Multiple Lentigines (LEOPARD Syndrome)
ranked_diseases.explanation: Excellent match with freckling/lentigines, cardiomyopathy, hypertelorism, growth delay, and typical facial features. The presence of cafe-au-lait spots and freckling strongly suggests this subtype.
Similar phenotype to NS1 but caused by PTPN11 mutations at different sites. Presents with same core features including cardiac involvement and typical facial dysmorphism.
RASopathy with overlapping features including cardiomyopathy, growth delay, hypertelorism, downslanted palpebral fissures, and macrocephaly. BRAF mutation-associated.
Combines features of both NF1 and Noonan syndrome. The presence of cafe-au-lait spots, freckling, and typical Noonan features suggests this overlap syndrome.
KRAS mutation-associated Noonan syndrome with similar phenotype but may have more severe intellectual disability and cardiac features.
Another RASopathy with cardiomyopathy, feeding difficulties, growth delay, and coarse facial features. HRAS mutation-associated but lacks some typical features.
SOS1 mutation-associated Noonan syndrome. Similar phenotype with prominent ectodermal features and normal intelligence typically.
